newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ shares shed morning gains to close flat.
newsitem.headline: NZ shares shed morning gains to close flat.

text.p: * NZ share market fails to rise with Wall Street
* Telecom seen key, continues to crab sideways
* Fletcher Energy rises on Brunei news
Price movements at close
LAST CHG * NZSE40 cap index -0.92 at 2,276.61

The New Zealand share market closed flat on Monday after the top 40 index lost morning gains.
Brokers said it was a disappointing performance given Wall Street's 95-point gain on Friday but they said there was no particular reason for the afternoon weakness.
"There was no follow-through. It's more selective interest out there than interest across the board," said JB Were broker Luke Koekoek.
The NZSE-40 capital index closed down 0.92 to 2276.61 on volume of NZ$51.1 million.
Telecom was a key reason for the market turnaround, ending square at $6.53 against its intraday high of $6.60.
Brokers said it was disappointing given the fall in interest rates over the past few days. Any rise hits a selling wall.
Lion Nathan, which ended seven down at NZ$3.50, was also seen as a disappointment. Its result last week was supposed to have cleared the air, brokers said.

One leader to fare better was Brierley, which ended two ahead at $1.30, possibly benefiting from speculation about the Fairfax newspaper group and a good performance from other of its Australian investments.
Fletcher Challenge Energy gained eight cents to NZ$4.32 after it announced a farm-out deal in Brunei which is seen improving production.
Others to outperform the market included retailers Hallenstein Glasson, up 13 to $2.25 and The Warehouse, up 11 to $3.86.
Property stocks were also well bid in response to the lower interest rate regime.
-- Simon Louisson, Wellington newsroom 64 4 4734 746
